meanings.definition: A traditional Japanese garment worn during summer festivals or other informal occasions.
meanings.sent1: During the festival, many people wore colorful yukatas.
meanings.sent2: She bought three yukatas for the upcoming summer festival.
meanings.sent3: The yukatas at the party looked like a rainbow of comfort.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of yukatas was a garden of patterns.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the yukatas fluttered in the warm breeze.

meanings.definition: The plural form of yukata, referring to multiple traditional Japanese garments.
meanings.sent1: In the shop, they displayed various yukatas for sale.
meanings.sent2: The group decided to wear matching yukatas to the event.
meanings.sent3: The closet was overflowing with colorful yukatas.
meanings.sent4: The garden party was a sea of blooming yukatas.
meanings.sent5: The market was bustling with vendors selling beautiful yukatas.
